response_planning.step_3: Structure answer: brief definitions + minimal code snippets + usage guidance

response_planning.step_5: Validate natural language patterns - reject formal/academic tone

step_1.name: Real Definition (Short & Clear)
step_1.instruction: Open with a clean, one-line explanation that avoids textbook jargon. Use natural language like 'So basically, the Strategy Pattern lets me pick a behavior at runtime by plugging in the right implementation.'

step_2.name: Core Components and Structure
step_2.instruction: Briefly describe the key components and how they interact at a high level before providing code. Keep it conversational.

step_3.name: Where I've Used It (Real Case)
step_3.instruction: Share a realistic use case from a microservices/Spring project where the pattern fit naturally. Include context and why it was chosen over alternatives. Use natural speech patterns.

step_4.name: Executable Code with Client
step_4.instruction: Provide clean, fully executable Java 17+ code that aligns with the real-world use case. Include a client class demonstrating usage. Handle edge cases like multithreading, serialization when applicable.

step_5.name: Trade-offs and Edge Cases
step_5.instruction: Mention at least one trade-off or edge case and show awareness of when the pattern might introduce complexity. Keep tone conversational.
